body: Overview topology: Keyed store ICs for element stores form a triage chain from the inline cache (KeyedStoreIC) through generated handler builtins (StoreFastElementIC_*/ElementsTransitionAndStore_*) into CodeStubAssembler (CSA) helpers and, on misses or complex cases, into runtime miss/slow entrypoints (Runtime::kKeyedStoreIC_Miss, Runtime::kElementsTransitionAndStoreIC_Miss). Anchor symbols and files used: ic/ic.cc:KeyedStoreIC::UpdateStoreElement (ic/ic.cc:2273), ic/ic.cc:RUNTIME_FUNCTION(Runtime_KeyedStoreIC_Miss) (ic/ic.cc:3113), builtins/builtins-handler-gen.cc:Generate_StoreFastElementIC / TF_BUILTIN(StoreFastElementIC_*) (builtins/builtins-handler-gen.cc:284-352), builtins/builtins-handler-gen.cc:Generate_ElementsTransitionAndStore / TF_BUILTIN(ElementsTransitionAndStore_*) (builtins/builtins-handler-gen.cc:141-193), accessor-assembler.cc:KeyedStoreIC() trampoline implementations (ic/accessor-assembler.cc:4131, 644), codegen/code-stub-assembler.cc:EmitElementStore / TransitionElementsKind / TryGrowElementsCapacity / CopyElementsOnWrite etc. (codegen/code-stub-assembler.cc:14094,14359,6653,14340), objects/elements.cc:TransitionElementsKindImpl / GrowCapacityAndConvertImpl / ConvertElementsWithCapacity (objects/elements.cc:991-1091), ic/handler-configuration{.h,-inl.h}:StoreHandler encodings and bitfields (ic/handler-configuration.h:67-369; ic/handler-configuration-inl.h:191-218). Topology summary: - Fast path: KeyedStoreIC sees a SMI-like index and JSReceiver map that is cacheable -> looks up/reads a handler (StoreFastElementBuiltin or StoreHandler) and tail-calls a builtin generated by HandlerBuiltinsAssembler, which in turn dispatches by elements kind and calls CSA helpers to perform element store (EmitElementStore) possibly after TransitionElementsKind. - Transition path: When an elements kind transition is required, builtins call TransitionElementsKind (runtime/TurboFan/Maglev nodes may represent this as TransitionElementsKind/TransitionElementsKindOrCheckMap); elements transition builtins (ElementsTransitionAndStore_*) will call TransitionElementsKind then EmitElementStore. - Miss/Slow path: CSA/builtins use TailCallRuntime to Runtime::kKeyedStoreIC_Miss or Runtime::kElementsTransitionAndStoreIC_Miss for cases not handled by ICs (e.g., proxies, interceptors, non-JSObjects, typed-array OOB handling complexity). - Polymorphic/megamorphic: KeyedStoreIC::UpdateStoreElement collects maps and handlers and configures FeedbackVector states (MONOMORPHIC/POLYMORPHIC/MEGAMORPHIC), updating handler entries through nexus()->Configure* and feedback vector writes in ic/ic.cc. Write barrier and store buffer emission occurs in CSA helper emissions used by EmitElementStore (codegen/code-stub-assembler.cc) and in object transition code (objects/elements.cc) where stores of HeapObject values trigger RecordWrite. Citations (internal anchors used as context): [ic_ic_UpdateStoreElement:ic/ic.cc:2273, ic_ic_KeyedStoreIC_Miss:ic/ic.cc:3113, builtins_handler_gen_StoreFastElementIC:builtins/builtins-handler-gen.cc:284-352, builtins_handler_gen_ElementsTransitionAndStore:builtins/builtins-handler-gen.cc:141-193, accessor_assembler_KeyedStoreIC:ic/accessor-assembler.cc:4131, code_stub_assembler_EmitElementStore:codegen/code-stub-assembler.cc:14094, code_stub_assembler_TryGrowElementsCapacity:codegen/code-stub-assembler.cc:6653, elements_TransitionElementsKindImpl:objects/elements.cc:991-1091, handler_configuration_bits:ic/handler-configuration.h:67-369].
explanation: High-level topology of KeyedStoreIC -> handler builtins -> CSA helpers -> runtime miss/slow. Useful as the canonical graph for where element stores are dispatched and where transitions are performed; anchors provide direct file:function pointers for deeper dives.
file_line: ic/ic.cc:2273; ic/ic.cc:3113; builtins/builtins-handler-gen.cc:284-352; ic/accessor-assembler.cc:4131; codegen/code-stub-assembler.cc:14094-14359; objects/elements.cc:991-1091; ic/handler-configuration.h:67-369
